required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gastric Emptying of Water in Obese Term Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Gastric Emptying of Water in Obese vs. Non-obese Term Pregnant Women Undergoing Elective Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock:
It has been believed that the risk of pulmonary aspiration in term pregnant women is increased, and should be considered that all term pregnant women to have "full stomach". Recently, gastric ultrasound has been adopted as a useful tool for quantitative and qualitative assessment of stomach before anesthesia, and predict the risk of pulmonary aspiration.
Although, both the obesity and pregnancy are known to be the risk of pulmonary aspiration, it is suggested in the American Society of Anesthesiology fasting guidelines, that the same fasting time should be applied in the obese and non-obese parturients. However, this was based on one study done in a small (10) numbers of volunteers.
Therefore, the investigators aimed to compare the gastric antral cross-sectional area in both obese and non-obese term pregnant women, scheduled for elective cesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, observational study. 42 term (≥37 weeks) pregnant, non-laboring adult women scheduled for cesarean delivery will be included in the study. They will be allowed to drink water freely, until 2 hours before the anesthesia. Gastric ultrasound will be performed in 21 non-obese women, and 21 obese women. The obesity is defined by the body mass index at term.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after the time allowed to drink water.
primary_outcome.description: Cross-sectional area of gastric antrum assessed by ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after the time allowed to drink water.
secondary_outcome.description: Preoperative anxiety is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after the time allowed to drink water.
secondary_outcome.description: Hunger score is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after the time allowed to drink water.
secondary_outcome.description: Thirst score is scored from 0 (never) to 10 (very much).

arm_group.description: body mass index lower than 30 (kg/m^2) at term
body mass index equal or greater than 30 (kg/m^2) at term

intervention.description: Drink water freely until 2 hours before anesthesia.

study_pop.textblock: Non laboring, term (≥37 weeks) pregnant women uldergoing elective cesarean section, in our medical center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non laboring, term (≥37 weeks) pregnant women
- Scheduled for elective cesarean section
- aged ≥ 18 years old
- American Society of Anesthesiology physical class 1-3
Exclusion Criteria:
- multigestational pregnancy
- diagnosed for delayed gastric emptying (GERD, gastrointestinal disease)
- diabetes
